channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Great earnings have these stocks firing
item.description: *sponsored by The Market Master‚Äôs Trading Room is open today but will be a little quiet, as we mourn the loss of JW‚Äôs stock market faithful companion, Bentley. Although Bentley could not ‚Äúlegally‚Äù tell someone to buy or sell a stock, a bark or two from him when JW was digging in it gave you [‚Ä¶]

item.title: Rocket Lab‚Äôs Archimedes engine test ‚Äòa significant catalyst‚Äô for new Neutron rocket, Cantor says
item.description: Rocket Lab reported a 71% second-quarter revenue hike after the market close Thursday. The company also said that it successfully fired its Archimedes engine for the first time. Rocket Lab shares are up 14.6% Friday.

item.title: Wall Street will get key insight on the consumer, inflation in the week ahead as recession fears swirl
item.description: With growth concerns moving to the fore, how the U.S. consumer is faring could be key to understanding what's next for markets and the economy.

item.title: S&P 500 rises, sharply curtails week's losses in major comeback from rout: Live updates
item.description: The S&P 500 managed to erase its losses for the week.

item.title: Major players are buying puts. Why?
item.description: *sponsored by We haven‚Äôt seen this since the-pandemic-that-shall-not-be-named. My trading partner Taiku pointed something out to me Tuesday that really opened my eyes to what‚Äôs going on in the markets. Yeah, we had a big sell-off earlier this week and the VIX spiked. But that‚Äôs not the real story‚Ä¶ the VIX gradually went back down [‚Ä¶]

item.title: Oil prices snap streak of 4 straight losing weeks
item.description: Worries over the U.S. economic outlook eased and traders braced for potential retaliatory strikes by Iran and its proxies against Israel after the assassination of a top Hamas official in Tehran last week.

item.title: Jeremy Siegel backs off on calls for the Fed to do an emergency interest rate cut
item.description: Siegel no longer thinks it's vital for an emergency interest rate reduction, but still wants policymakers to cut quickly and aggressively.

item.title: Plane with 62 people aboard crashes in fiery wreck in Brazil's Sao Paulo state
item.description: The firefighters corps confirmed that the plane fell in the city of Vinhedo, but did not offer more details.

item.title: AstraZeneca partners with tiny Biotech

item.title: Steak, dinner and more men: These have been keys to Sweetgreen‚Äôs recent growth
item.description: Sweetgreen‚Äôs stock soars as a key sales-growth metric reaches its highest level in two years and new initiatives pay off.

item.title: Stellantis laying off 2,450 plant workers due to discontinuation of Ram 'Classic' pickup truck
item.description: Stellantis will indefinitely lay off up to 2,450 U.S. plant workers later this year as it discontinues production of an older version of its Ram 1500 pickup.

item.title: Markets no longer think the Fed needs to be as aggressive with interest rate cuts
item.description: Market pricing points to about a coin flip between the probability of a quarter-point or half-point reduction in September.

item.title: Boeing bondholders get defensive ahead of potential downgrade to junk
item.description: Boeing‚Äôs bondholders have adopted a defensive trade in the last week of selling certain longer-dated notes and buying other, more recently issued bonds that will pay them more if the aerospace giant‚Äôs credit is downgraded.

item.title: 10-year Treasury yield dips as traders weigh state of U.S. economy after latest data
item.description: U.S. Treasury yields were slightly lower early Friday as investors continue to assess weekly jobless claims data.

item.title: Jeremy Siegel backs off on calls for the Fed to do an emergency interest rate cut
item.description: Siegel no longer thinks it's vital for an emergency interest rate reduction, but still wants policymakers to cut quickly and aggressively.

item.title: Elizabeth Warren probes student-loan transfer that tanked borrowers‚Äô credit scores
item.description: The letter to student-loan servicers and credit-reporting agencies is the latest example of scrutiny from the U.S. senator and consumer advocates.

item.title: Trump says he should get a say on Federal Reserve interest rate decisions
item.description: The comments seem to reinforce reporting earlier this year that advisors close to Trump are looking at a host of changes for the Fed.

item.title: Bitcoin bounces back above $60,000 as cryptocurrency's rise continues to end week: CNBC Crypto World
item.description: CNBC Crypto World features the latest news and daily trading updates from the digital currency markets and provides viewers with a look at what's ahead with high-profile interviews, explainers, and unique stories from the ever-changing crypto industry. On today's show, Ben McMillan, chief investment officer of IDX Digital Assets, weighs in on this week's volatility and Resy co-founder Ben Leventhal explains how his new web3 project would allow for diners to pay for meals in crypto.
